statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Oakland, Mich. 64, Valparaiso 61
article.story: ROCHESTER, Mich. (AP) -- Johnathan Jones scored 19 points and Oakland added four free throws in the final 26 seconds to hold off Valparaiso 64-61 Saturday afternoon in the final Mid-Continent Conference meeting between the teams. After losing their first 16 meetings with the Crusaders, Oakland (15-11, 8-2 Mid-Con) won the last three, including a season sweep this year. Valparaiso (13-13, 6-5) is moving to the Horizon League next season. Vova Severovas added 13 points and seven rebounds for Oakland, while Derick Nelson had 12 points and nine rebounds. Urule Igbavboa and Shawn Huff led the Crusaders with 14 each, while Jarryd Loyd added 13 off the bench. Oakland led by nine points midway through the second half, but the Crusaders rallied to within 56-54 with 3:15 left. Nelson's free throw and a 3-pointer by Jones gave Oakland some breathing room, but Valparaiso got the margin back to two with a minute left. This time, Nelson hit both shots from the line, and even after Brandon McPherson's off-balance 3-pointer, Brandon Cassise made two more fouls shots. Huff missed a long tying 3-pointer at the buzzer. In Oakland's previous game, a 64-63 upset loss to Western Illinois, Nelson had missed the front end of a one-and-one that could have clinched the game with 21 seconds to play.
